column4: Hi, I'm not sure how to use IRC, but I need help installing ubuntu, can anyone help?
for a laptopor desktop
Desktop, brand new iMac running Leopard  and Parallels
IRC hint, when talking to someone specific, put their nick in the line.  It will highlight and/or beep to the person you're talking to.
nicks are easier to complete by typing the first few characters then hitting tab.. look to see if it completed the nick correctly.  If not try again with more characters.
How's that?
good
Can You Help me?
maybe.. not being overly familure with mac, are you trying to setup a dual boot or using parrells?
I think that I am trying to set up a dual boot, as I understand it Parallels will allow me to run both osx and ubuntu at the same time
ok.. dual boot will give you one or the other... do you have bootcamp?
no, I am using Parallels

correct me if I'm wrong, but will Parallels allow you to load Mac's OS and Linux at the same time and let you bounce back and forth between the two or is it transparent.  That is running programs for both at the same time?
As I understand it I can bounce back and forth between the two
ok.. to install you have to be able to boot to the Ubuntu Live CD from within parelles.  Do you know how to do that?
I downloaded ubuntu 7.10 burnt a disc, as instructed, but parallels won't see the disc

Ok you probably need parallels "Image" of Ubuntu to get it to run.. here's a link I found for an image.. not sure which version of Ubuntu it is though.  Looks like Xubuntu.  http://digg.com/linux_unix/Triple_Boot_Using_Parallels_Run_Ubuntu_on_your_Macbook_using_Parallels
or rather http://ramsinks.vox.com/library/post/xubuntu-parellels-image-for-macbooks.html
OK I will try that , once I do can I check back with you if you are available?

here's another link that might be more helpful.  It shows how to use any Ubuntu ISO image in Parallels. http://xanana.ucsc.edu/~wgscott/xtal/wiki/index.php/Running_Linux_via_Parallels_inside_another_operating_system
I've gotta run see clients but someone here will help.
Thank you for your time
no problem
